question:
Which of the following statements is/are true for the recipients of the Sangeet Natak Akademi Awards?
Sonal Mansingh was elected as Fellow of Sangeet Natak Akademi in the year 2018.
2.Jatin Goswami was elected as Fellow of Sangeet Natak Akademi in the year 2018.
3.Radha Sridhar received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in the year 2018 for her contribution to Kathak.
[SSC SP-12 2024 T-1]
solution:
The correct answer is: - Both 1 and 3

Explanation:

  • Sonal Mansingh (b. 1944) is a celebrated Bharatanatyam and Odissi dancer. She began training at age 7 and founded the Centre for Indian Classical Dances in 1977. She received the Padma Bhushan (1992), Padma Vibhushan (2003), and was elected Fellow of Sangeet Natak Akademi in 2018.
  • Jatin Goswami (b. 1933) is a pioneer of Sattriya, a classical dance of Assam. He founded Alok Shilpi Sangha and Pragjyoti Kala Parishad, and was instrumental in getting Sattriya recognized as a classical form. He received the SNA Award (2004), Padma Shri (2008), and was elected Fellow of SNA in 2018.
  • Radha Sridhar, a renowned Bharatanatyam guru from Bengaluru, received the Sangeet Natak Akademi Award in 2018, but for Bharatanatyam, not Kathak. She founded Venkatesha Natya Mandir and trained under U.S. Krishna Rao and Muthaiah Pillai.

👉 Thus, statements 1 and 2 are correct, while statement 3 is incorrect.

question: Who received the Bharat Ratna in 2024 for their exceptional contributions to Indian politics?
solution:
In 2024, Bharat Ratna was awarded to Five eminent personalities:

  • Karpoori Thakur (posthumous) – Former Bihar CM, champion of social justice and reservation policies for backward classes.
  • P.V. Narasimha Rao (posthumous) – Former PM of India, known for initiating economic reforms in 1991.
  • Chaudhary Charan Singh (posthumous) – Former PM and noted farmer leader, known as 'Champion of India's peasants'.
  • Lal Krishna Advani: Veteran BJP leader, former Deputy Prime Minister of India. Recognised for his lifelong contribution to Indian politics and nation-building.
  • M.S. Swaminathan (posthumous): Renowned agricultural scientist, known as ‘Father of India’s Green Revolution’. His research ensured India’s food security in the 1960s–70s.

Bharat Ratna:

India’s highest civilian Award, “Jewel of India”

  • Establishment: 2 January 1954 by former President of India Rajendra Prasad
  • Provision to award posthumously was added in January 1966.
  • The first Bharat Ratna was awarded to Sarvapalli Radhakrishnan, Sir C.V. Raman, and Chakravarti Rajagopalachari in 1954.
  • Sachin Tendulkar is the first sportsperson and the youngest Bharat Ratna Award, recipient.
  • Symbolism: The Bharat Ratna is symbolized by a peepal leaf-shaped medallion with the national emblem of India engraved on it. It is accompanied by a certificate signed by the President of India.
